string.text: What's your business here stalker?
I've been sent to help the scientists.
They sent you? Well, you don't look much like a trained professional! Oh well, you may pass, but watch your step stalker!
Thanks for the tip.
Just wandering around, seeing the sights.
Well piss off, this isn't a tourist destination. You're lucky we're told to be lax with you people near the eggheads.
Alright then, see you.
Yes stalker, can I help you with anything?
Sidorovich sent me. He said you needed some work done.

Ah yes, we have been expecting you Marked One. This assignment is very sensitive in nature, something I want to keep low profile if possible. I... made a deal with mercenaries so that they would acquire a certain package for me. I need you to go to their base in Deadcity and recover the package. You only have to pick it up and bring it back to me in one piece; they have already received their payment.
If I may, what sort of package is it? I'm not in the mood to deal with some brain-sucking parasite or anything of the like.
No need to worry, it isn't a live specimen or organic at all. It's research material dug up from an old laboratory in the North. I can't say anything else. Bring it to me, and I will reward you well.
OK then, I'll be back with the package.
I am here about your package.
Do you have the package for me yet?
No, I'm still working on it.
Yes, here it is.
Hello, professor. I no longer need your prototype helmet, you can take it.
Even so... Are you sure you don't need it anymore?
Yes, I'm sure. Take it, and thank you!
Although you know... I changed my mind. Maybe I'll need it later. I'll give it back later.

Thank you, this means a lot to us. With what the mercenaries did, I won't ever make any deals with them again. Even if the package was worth the trouble. I don't think the Army will appreciate any transactions with them anymore. Not to mention they took the Doctor prisoner... And from what I've heard, you're a friend of his. Lucky coincidence I guess? Anyhow, I've heard that your PDA is damaged. I can repair it for you, but I'll need a few things to get it going again. First is new wiring. There is an entrance to an underground lab nearby; try looking around there for some in the storerooms. That's your best bet. Bring some back to me and then I'll tell you what else I need.
OK, I will go right away!
About the new wiring you asked for.
Do you have the new wiring for me?
No, not yet.
Do remember, I can't fix this PDA without it.
Alright, I'm on it.
Yes, here it is.
Could you tell me, professor, have you heard about the suits that were designed before the first blowout in the Zone?

Indeed, I've already been gathering info on that for quite a time. The ecolog suits that we use now were developed on the base of blueprints that I found in some "secret" archives. But I haven't seen a single one.
But there is a probability that these suits can be found here.
There is, but I doubt that. I think that everything was already moved out. Maybe they left something over in a rush, but that probability is small.
I'd try to find it, if I knew where to start.
Have you been in the underground facilities, the ones under the lake? There's so much there laying around, but nobody have the guts to go there. A creepy place, you know.
I'll push my luck. Well, thanks a lot.
Professor, I urgently need your help!
What happened?!
The brain in the laboratory! It's still working... my head hurts so much!
So, calm down and tell me everything.

I was in the lake underground and in one room I saw a huge brain in a tank. As I came closer to it my head was pierced with pain, then I passed out and couldn't even remember how I got out of that room.
Yes... Psi-emitters. I know much of it. I can help you to protect yourself from the psi-rays, if you're interested.
Yeah, of course I am: I have to get through, but that brain blocks the way.

Then take this helm and this measurement device. The helm help you to hold for sometime around the brain to measure the wave frequency of a psi rays. After the measurement I can configure the helm to provide full protection from rays.
Thank you for help, professor!
Well, I already have such device, so yours is not needed. Thank you for help anyway, professor!
Done all the measurements. Wasn't easy and I was hit by the psi attack again.

Emissions of each brain are individual, so you can't design a helm that would protect from every psi emitter. This is why the first version of the helm didn't help much. Let me tweak the parameters...
Will it help me?
Sure: you've done the measurements, didn't you? Here, it's ready. Now the protection should suffice to get you through.
Thanks a bunch, professor.
You're welcome.
Professor, I'm looking for something here.
Yeah, I'm listening.
The old docs which the Yantar facility workers may have left here. Is it possible to find anything?
Well, probably: they ran a lot of experiment here. And I already have some docs: I look for such documentation, too.
Any thoughts on the search direction? And could you show me your part of these?

You can look anywhere: there were lots of facilities and laboratories here. Actually, let's do it that way: I'll send a group of researchers with you to explore the places where the documents may have been left. You'll also need to bring all the electronics you find: recorders, measurement devices and other tiny things. And when you return, I'll make a copy of the documents I have.
Well, sounds like a good deal. Let's get to it then.
Discuss it with professor Pirozhenko: he'll be the expedition leader.
Alright. I shall go now. Thank you for the help!

Ah, very good, not even a scratch on them. OK then, the next thing we need is new circuit boards, and I know where we can get some in mint condition. I was just in contact with Doc, and it appears he has some for us. He would also like to discuss other matters with you too. He told me that he would be waiting for you in his house in the Great Swamp. You'll have to be careful though, there is a Military helicopter on patrol at the moment, and they are quite trigger happy. They'll shoot anything that moves. Just move through the reeds so they won't see you. I'll try to contact the helicopter to tell them of your arrival and not to shoot, good luck stalker!
I'll go right away.
Here is my PDA, can you fix it now?
Do you have the circuit boards for me?
Yes, here they are.
OK good, we can begin repairs on the PDA. Did Doc mention that we needed a special Crystal artifact too?
Yes, feels like I've been to hell and back trying to find it!

Excellent, now I have the last piece of the puzzle to repair your PDA, ohhh this is a nice Crystal! It will only take a few minutes. Why don't you go and talk to Kruglov in the shed while you're waiting. He could use some company. I'll have it fixed up when you return.
OK, great, see you shortly.
He did tell me about it, but I didn't get it yet.
Well, best you do. We cannot complete the fix without it!
OK, OK, I'll get it.
Doc said it was pretty urgent that you meet him. Best be on your way; we old people get cranky when we're left hanging.
OK, OK I'm going.
I told you it will take a while, go see Kruglov in the shed.
OK, OK, I'm going.

Ah... Marked One, unfortunately, I was not able to bring full functionality back to your PDA... I recovered some corrupted data though, it wasn't much, here, take a look. I apologize I was not able to completely fix it.
Thanks professor, I appreciate your help regardless.
Sure, no problem. Don't be a stranger; you're welcome here anytime stalker. We might have work for you if you ever need a little cash.
OK, I'll see you around.
About this special artefact...
Have you found the artifact yet?
No, I haven't.
Hmm, haven't seen your face around here before. Report to Professor Sakharov in the bunker and make your intentions known.
Will do.
So you've gotten acquainted with Sakharov? Good. Now you won't get funny looks from the others.
Hmm, haven't seen your face around here before. You've gotten acquainted with Sakharov? Good. Now you won't get funny looks from the others.
Nice to meet you.
What do you do here?
A bit of this and a lot of that. I manage expeditions and oversee field tests from time to time. Tell you what, I'll tell you more later when you're not so busy with the professor.
See you around.
I told you to come back later when you've complete Sakharov's assignment!
OK, OK, see you later.
Hello again, what are you up to?
Professor sent me to you. He said we have something to discuss.
Yes, there are several questions, though i didn't know how to ask them in delicate way... there are rumors in camp. Can you dispel all this fog?
Sure, ask me.

You are the one, Strelok... correct? There are legends about your adventures. As far as i heard, this isn't your first attempt to reach the center of the Zone and the last one "misfortunes" drove you right up to the Generators. I am interested in a specific moment: how you got out alive from this place? The scale of radiation contamination there.. enormous, sarcofagus of Chernobyl NPP is completely deadly, also psi-emitters, which directly affect the mind, cerebellum and intelligence, in general the average man faced with such energy frequency drops combined with radioactive isotopes, couldn't survive at this area, even in the exoskeleton, or well, become a mutant.
I lost my memory, completely, now I gather the remains of it as a grain of salt.
Well, there were probably some pop-up moments from the subconscious or you totaly do not remember anything at all?

I remember only a bright flash during blowout and falling into the abyss... then I was carried somewhere, in an almost unconscious state, I was in some kind of... capsule, and the silhouettes around in white coats; it felt like they observed me and tried to say something, but I do not remember what, only then pain and total darkness. I woke up in Sidorovich's bunker, like a blank sheet of paper: no friends, no relatives... I felt lost.

Thanks for the info. I appreciate this frankness. As soon as all this will be over or you remember something else, come back to me, we will have something to discuss. From the science point of view, your experience is priceless. I hope one day you will join us in our difficult matter of studying the Zone.
Hi, Strelok. How I deserved this new meeting?
Well, you said you would tell me in details what it is that you do here.

Like I said, I'm a sort of manager and assistant for the Ecologist operations in Yantar. But mainly I'm known around here for training wild dogs. They're no German Shepherds, but they do one heck of a job.
Interesting. It must be time consuming though.
You have any special tasks?
I have a personal task for you if you're interested?
Sure, what is it?

A very famous composer lived in the forest not far from the bar. He has long passed but it is rumored that there could still be some of his music sheets lying around his house. Please go and check for me and I will give you a just reward.
Sure thing, I`ll bring anything I find.
Sorry, I have too much on my plate now.
About the composers house.
Did you find anything at the house yet?
Yes, I found this music sheet there.
Splendid, good job, I`m a huge fan, this is so big for me you have no idea. Here is a token of my appreciation.
Thanks doc, anytime.
No doc, still working on that.
Hello. It looks like I'm going with you.
Now listen here, stalker: I'm no Sakharov, and I won't coddle around with you; the lives of my crew are my top priority.
I can handle myself, don't you worry.
Believe me: I don't. If you seem suspicious or run away in a tough situation - I'll kill you: I know how to hold a gun.
Yeah, and stalkers call ecologs sissies...
Two more guys will come with us: my assistant, stalker Kalmyk, and professor Kuleshov. We'll set off immediately, go tell the others.
Alright, I'll be quick.
So, it seems like you're the one to assist us?
Yes, Sakharov sent me on the mission with you. Could you tell me what exactly are we doing?

Well, as far as I know, we'll revisit all the "mysterious" rooms around and under the lake Yantar, and we'll get everything that's left, like docs and tools; we'll also need to do some measurements. But what can we do? We have to. I'm not a good shooter, so I'll be doing the measurements.
Yeah, that's alright. Good luck to us.
Yeah, we could use some luck. And what do you think? Nothing we can do...
Let's go.
Hello, stalker. Have you joined the expedition as well? And what do you actually do here in general?
Yes, I have. I work as an assistant here: escort them most of the time, get 'em the artifacts.
Do you like it?
The job is cushy; besides, I've got an offical pass to the Zone - but the military sometimes doesn't care, so I have to get in here the old-fashioned way.
Yeah, there surely are some benefits.

So, aren't you afraid to go with us? The Zone itself is a terrible place, but Yantar is one of the worst: either the brains are boiling or zombies are coming from every hole. And there's a shitload of monsters - it seems like they're coming here from all over the Zone.
Well, I'm not new to the Zone, so I'm not afraid.
That's good, let's go.
Alright, everybody's ready.

Here's a last piece of advice: stick together, I'll lead the way; don't get too far from us, but not too close either; you've got to let us pass and bring up the rear. And strictly follow my orders - I don't stand objections in case of emergency.
I got it, let's move.
So, that's the first place?
Yes. Strange place: stalkers always refuse to get in here. Ask Kuleshov about the situation and we'll go in.
What can you say, profesor?
The readings are going off-scale. But what can we do?
Well, we have to go forward. Let's get inside.
Like we have a choice. Let's go.
Creepy place.
Damn, how many of these assholes are there? My head hurts... hard to think...
What's the plan now?
There's something on the shelf - can you see it? We got to get it. Go take it while we're covering you.
Yeah, but keep your eyes peeled: it's gonna be tough for me.
What can you say, professor?
What do you think? The readings are really going crazy now. But what can we do...?
Are you staying here?
I don't like zombies: these things always frighten me, make me nervous. You'd better ask our assistant: he faced them many times, he'll help you.
Are you staying here too?
No, we'll go together: it'll be smoothier this way.
Alright, let's go then.
Phew, what a mess... although it could be worse in the Zone.
Well, we knew the risk we take. And we've got off pretty easily. So what? Two dozens of zombies are not the worst thing.
What's next?
We're going forward. Next stop is the abandoned hangar. We'll do it the same way: you go the last.
Let's go.
What can you say?
What's there to say? We've got out and that's good.
That's right. Better not jinx it.
What's next, professor?
What do you think? Go to our leader for orders - he's the one deciding. But what can we do...
Alright.
We'd be lucky to get to the place - not even find something.
That's right. Now go check that house - there may be something interesting inside.
Alright, I'll go check it.
What are the readings, professor?
Nothing here. What did you think?
And what do we do?
Well, we've got to check the hangar inside. But what can we do...
If we got to - we'll do it.
What do we have here?
God damn it, dead scientist! I've never seen him at our base. Wears a labcoat without a suit... he even looks strange.
Well, you can encounter even stranger things here. He's a shadow of the past.
You think he was one of the scientists doing all those experiments? Then his body couldn't last so long.
You never know. It could be irradiated by something, so it never rot.
Yeah, that's possible.
No, there's nothing in the house.
Are you sure? Nothing at all?
Yes. There's no furniture, no stuff, nothing related to the Zone experiments.
Then we should check the hangar. Will you do it?
Already been there. No idea what's there: only some scientist's corpse. But I've brought all the devices I could find.
Yeah, I'll go check it.
I've searched the hangar. No idea what's there: only some scientist's corpse. But I've brought all the devices I could find.

Let's move then. Do you see the gates? They're locked, no way to get in there from here. Behind them there is a small room and stairs. It leads to a hangar connected the other Yantar underground facilities. This hangar is never being paid attention to, so we should search it.
Will we go through the tunnels?
No - too far from here and also dangerous. We'll go through the military base, I'll make the passes.
Like real IDs?
No, Sakharov have already contacted them. You are allowed to go through with us, and we are always welcome there, as you know.
How do we go?
The bridge collapsed a long time ago and we won't get around it. We'll go down, there's a breach in the fence - that's how.
Am I going the last again?
Yup, that's right.
Let's go then.
What's that?

Change of plan: you shouldn't go through a narrow tunnel with a bunch of people, so we've decided to send you alone - as the most experienced. I took care of everything already: military will let you through.
Great, but explain the task again.

You can get to the basement from the second floor; then you'll be able to get to the tunnels. Look around there and get every device there is. There's no point in taking measurements there, it's too deep underground, so there's nothing interesting. Just get all the electronics.
Understood. Stroll in a basement is an ordinary thing for me already. I'll get it done.
Good luck. We'll wait for you at the base.
Done, I've looked all over the place.
And what was there?
Nothing of interest: just zombies and burers. Found a couple of things, most likely to be useful for you.

I'm glad that you've got out. We haven't been out for quite a time, there's some point in such missions. That's not sitting on the ass in the labs! Go back to Sakharov, I think he'll like all the things you've found. And here's a little present from me.
Thanks, see you next time.
So, professor, how did you like our little venture?
Well, it was good to get some fresh air! What do you think? We were lucky to stay alive, but what can we do?
What about the next expedition?
Oh no, enough expeditions - for a month at least. What can I do? There's more than enough research info for now. We've also got to decrypt the devices.
Good luck to you.
Hello professor, I'm here about the job.
Yes, I'm listening.
Everything went smoothly: we've got to every checkpoint and taken everything we need.
I'm still in the process.
Great news! I'm very pleased! Quick, give me everything please! And what about the measurements? Have you done them?
Bring me good news! I'm hoping you'll get it done soon.
Yeah, professor Kuleshov was doing them all the time, but I don't know much. You'd better ask him yourself.
Indeed I will! Here's a humble reward for such a great work done! And, of course, here's my part of the documents.
I'm glad to help you, especially for a reward! Thanks, professor.
Thanks again!
I've got bad news for you: we've lost a crew member. We had to call off the operation and get back to the base.
Such sad news... well, I shouldn't have sent you on such a hard job without any practice. The Yantar area is very dangerous - especially for a newbie team.
My condolences.
That's not your fault: this is the Zone. But I won't mind if you still want to help us.
That depends.
It would be a shame to leave the operation without any results, so I propose you to do it on your own.
Yes, I don't mind. I'll take the job.
We've already managed to do something, done a part of the job. We've been at the first checkpoint, and I'd found something there.
We've already managed to do something, done a part of the job. We've been at two checkpoints, I'd found many interesting things there.
I've already been at every checkpoint and had taken everythig I could. There's no point in going somewhere else.
Great! Then go to professor Pirozhenko: he'll mark the locations and explain the task.
Okay.
No, I'm sorry professor: too risky. This job doesn't make any sense, I think it's pointless.
Good, let's see what we have here. Yes, very interesting! Well, will you get the job done? We need data from the remaining checkpoints.
Yes, I want to finish the job.
No, I'm sorry professor: too risky. This job doesn't make any sense, I think it's pointless.
Well, then here it is - my part of the documents. Like I promised.
Great, Marked One! You've made my day. Quick, give me everything. And here's your reward!
Hello there, professor! It's me again, with a PDA I want to be cracked.
Hello. I can already call hacking my hobby, so give it here.
Alright. It's from the Major, though.
Well... cracking password... we got it!
Thank you! Well, I hope Major will pay you himself.
Well yeah, it keeps me busy, but I'm using it as a base for cognitive research on the breeds of dogs in the Zone. Would you be interested in buying one of my trained dogs?
Next time, though thanks for offer.

I am on a mission from General Voronin. We want to shut down the Brain Scorcher and X16 for good and open up the path to the center. He said you have a psy-helmet that will protect me from the psy-emissions.

Oh, well... we had a fine-tuned psy-helmet that could've protected you from such strong psy-emissions, but I already sent it with one of our men to the science bunker at the concrete factory. You can go there and ask my colleague Deedee for it on my behalf. I do have an experimental prototype here with me which you can take.
Is it any good? You're not just offloading a useless piece of junk on me are you?
It will help you reach the old road that leads to the concrete factory at least. You will have to be quick though. But beggars can't be choosers, right?
I suppose so. I'll take it then.
Here it is. Good luck out there stalker!
I'll need it for sure. Thanks for the help professor.
Don't mention it.

Hey! I need some help please brother... I was out searching for artifacts and all of a sudden realized I stumbled right into the middle of a Bloodsucker den! Holy shit was I scared.\nThey started chasing me! I dropped my shooter and ran; I never want to go back there. Can you help me and go into the underground and get my shooter back brother?
Bloodsuckers you say? How many were there?
Oh... about six, I think...
Damn, OK, but if I am going to risk my neck like that, you are going to have to cough up a very nice payment!

For sure brother! Oh hey, one other thing... I got this off the dead body of some scientist in that area. It looks like some kind of scent blocker! Maybe if you put this on, the bloodsuckers won't attack you, unless you shoot one I guess.\nI didn't have time to try it, but I am way too scared to even go back there, even with this stuff! Not sure how long this stuff will last so its best to run.
Sure man, give me that vial and I'll go get your shooter.
Sure man, no problem, I don't need that vial! I can take care of this without it!
No thanks, sounds too risky.
Wait... Are you talking about this gun?
Yes! It's her! Look, can you give it back? I'll give you a reward.
Take it.
Hey brother, please tell me you changed your mind?
Hey brother, did you get it for me?
Not yet, work in progress.
No dude, and you can forget me getting it too, that place is crawling with them!
Yeah, here it is. That place is crawling with them, I wouldn't venture down there again if I were you!
Thank you so much stalker, here, take this suit as a sign of my gratitude.
Thanks man, be careful out there, don't let the Bloodsuckers bite!
Thanks again stalker!
Don't mention it.
Hey brother, are you our reinforcement? We have been waiting for you for 2 days now and totally lost control over the situation!
Yes, I was sent by Voronin to figure out what the current situation is. What's going on here?
Nope, I am just walking around.
Then get lost! We are busy if you haven't noticed!

We have big problems man. The messenger that Voronin sent was killed by bandits and they also attacked our position! So now we have a bunch of wounded men here. We need to retake control of this high ground, can you help us?
Of course, I will take care of them. Where are they located?

I'll mark their position on your PDA, let them have it for all they did to us. I think they deserve to burn in hell! I recommend caution though, there are plenty of mutants around too, lake yantar is not a place for newbies to be wondering around. By the way, I have additional work here for you.. want it? It's not a big job but needed..
Not interested.
Of course.

When these bastards attacked our position, they not only sprayed us with lead, but those buggers from the village stole my favourite guitar!! Bastards, I can't forgive them for that. We also had a case with some stuff to...you know...make the days easier...if you understand what I mean! Bastards from the gas station group took it! Can you try and find these things in their respective camps, please?
You can count on me.
Thank you, thank you man! I had already lost all hope of dealing with these bastards. I will put in a good report about what you did for us.
No problem. All for one and one for all.
Did you manage to find all my stuff yet?
No not yet, but soon!
Yes, both of them.
Well then, I have a present for you. Here it is, light as can be, we found it in an anomaly nearby.
Hey thanks, I really appreciate it. See you boys around.
About your stolen stuff. Here it is.
Hey brother, thank you for helping us recover the stolen items, I have a present for you. Here it is, light as can be, we found it in an anomaly nearby.
Bandits dead?
Not yet. Working on it...
Yes. I killed them all.
Hi, are you a repairman?
Hello, son. Yes, I'm trying to help stalkers like you every way I can.
So that means that you can upgrade my suit and weapons too?
I don't think I have the proper equipment for that, son.
I could bring some tools. If you upgrade my things afterwards. What do you say?
I don't mind that. It would be great if you get them.
Alright, I'll do that.
I'm here about the tools.
What do you got there?
Brought you something, a tools for rough work.
Brought you something, a tools for fine work.
Got you a calibration toolkit.
Good job. Well, now I need tools for rough work.
Good job. Well, now I need tools for fine work.
Good job. Well, now I need calibration toolkit.
Good job. Well, now I need tools for rough and fine work.
Good job. Well, now I need tools for rough work and calibrations.
Good job. Well, now I need tools for fine work and calibrations.
That's all! Now I have a complete set. I can upgrade whatever you want!
